page.title: 09Freshwater Around Tenbury 2
page.content: which can lead to serious flooding.In the great flood of November 17,1770 the Shropshire half of Teme Bridge as then existing was carried away;or at least it was much damaged.The bridge was then rebuilt by Thomas Telford the famous engineer.He was appointed County Surveyor of Shropshire in 1787. Another great flood of 1946 swept right up Teme Street to about the Corner Shop which is a shop just at the end of Market Street and the start of Teme Street. Last year (1984) JCBs and other diggers went down to the Teme to try and make the water go through all the arches of the Teme Bridge and three or four months later they succeeded in doing this. This year (1985) we have had a lot of rain and the Teme is very high and fast flowing in Tenbury Wells.
